definition: victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)

sentences.english: This alone will improve the usability of your product because some testing is far better than no testing.
sentences.chinese: 這樣也能聊勝於無的提高您產品的可用性。

sentences.english: It's not perfect, but it is there.
Still, saving even a little is better than saving nothing at all.
sentences.chinese: 聊勝於無，哪怕只存一點點也比什麼都不存要好很多。

sentences.english: Still, even uncertain data seems better than none at all.
sentences.chinese: 不過即使是具有不確定性的數據看上去也聊勝於無。

sentences.english: Making mistakes for pursuing truth is much better than doing nothing.
sentences.chinese: 爲了追求真理而犯錯是聊勝於無。

definition: When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
lit. drinking poison in the hope of quenching one's thirst (idiom)/fig. a supposed remedy that only makes matters worse
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
